main event: On October 7, 1956, there was an observation of several unidentified objects in the sky near Branford Field, Connecticut, involving ground radar and visual sightings of 3 to 5 bright circular objects moving towards the water, disappearing after a 2-minute observation.
interesting points: The objects were observed visually and through lower binoculars for more than 2 minutes.
The objects were not identified as any known aircraft and were also observed through ground radar.
The objects were described as circular and pulsating, with a pulsating light source that appeared to alter in size.
They were observed at a high altitude, with their size compared to that of a full moon.
The objects displayed vertical flight, hovered momentarily, then suddenly disappeared from view.
